summary: WebAssembly memory errors and threading issues when running Temporal SDK TypeScript tests with vitest instead of jest, causing crashes and unhandled rejections. Resolved in version 1.5.0.
userImpact: Users migrating from jest to vitest for testing cannot run tests with multi-threading enabled, requiring them to disable parallelization or stay on jest.
rootCause: Incompatibility between Temporal SDK's native core-bridge module and vitest's threading model for WebAssembly memory isolation across worker threads.
workaround: Disable multi-threading in vitest configuration or continue using jest for testing.
resolutionDetails: Fixed in version 1.5.0, presumably by PR #983. Users confirmed the issue is resolved and can now use vitest.
keyQuote: Apparently resolved as of 1.5.0 (presumably by #983). I can no longer reproduce any of the reported errors.
